sections.title: Basic Concepts
content: 1. Time taken by a train of length X meters to pass a pole or a standing person = Time to cover X meters = X / Speed
2. Time taken by a train of length X meters to pass a stationary object of length b meters = Time to cover (X + b) meters = (X + b) / Speed

sections.title: Relative Speed
content: 3. If two trains are moving in the same direction at u m/s and v m/s (u > v), their relative speed = u − v m/s
4. If two trains are moving in opposite directions at u m/s and v m/s, their relative speed = u + v m/s

sections.title: Time to Cross Each Other
content: 5. Two trains of length a meters and b meters moving in opposite directions at u m/s and v m/s:
Time to cross = (a + b) / (u + v) seconds

sections.title: Time to Overtake (Same Direction)
content: 6. Two trains of length a meters and b meters moving in the same direction at u m/s and v m/s (u > v):
Time to cross = (a + b) / (u − v) seconds

sections.title: Speed Ratio from Remaining Times After Meeting
content: 7. Two trains start at the same time from points A and B toward each other. After meeting, they take a and b seconds to reach B and A respectively:
Speed of A : Speed of B = √b : √a
